doc.previous: For example, suppose a consumer's consumption set is X =Â {nothing, 1Â apple,1Â orange, 1Â apple and 1Â orange, 2Â apples, 2Â oranges}, and its utility function is u(nothing)Â =Â 0, u(1Â apple)Â =Â 1, u(1Â orange)Â =Â 2, u(1Â apple and 1Â orange)Â =Â 4, u(2Â apples)Â =Â 2 and u(2Â oranges)Â =Â 3. Then this consumer prefers 1 orange to 1 apple, but prefers one of each to 2 oranges.
doc.after: A utility function represents a preference relation on X iff for every , implies . If u represents , then this implies is complete and transitive, and hence rational.
